Name: Bloodhound #1
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Nick & Nora glass .
MUDDLE raspberries in base of shaker.
Review: Looks like fruity disco drink fodder but is actually surprising dry and strong.
History: Unknown but in his 1922 Mixing Cocktails , Harry MacElhone credits the Duke of Manchester,  William Angus Drogo Montagu (1877-1947). The Bloodhound first appears, in a simple form, in William Boothby's 1907 World Drinks ,  the, in Tom Bullock's 1917 The Ideal Bartender , and perhaps most notably in in Harry Craddock 's 1930 The Savoy Cocktail Book .
